main event: On May 24, 1951, a cigar-shaped object with a mile-long exhaust flame was observed in Chicago, Illinois, moving at a high rate of speed, oscillating and sending Morse code-like signals, before disappearing from sight.
interesting points: The object was described as brilliant white in color and had a slight wobble, resembling a fish gliding through space.
Neighbors also witnessed the flight of the rocket, and the witness notified the press assuming it had been seen by many people.
The witness reported the spectacle to Field Artillery Observance Control and Fifth Army Intelligence when no notice of it appeared in the daily papers.

The document describes an incident in Downey, California on May 29, 1951, where thirty glowing, meteor-like objects with intense electric-blue light made fantastic right-angled turns, covering about 80 degrees of sky in 25 seconds, estimated to be traveling at 1,700 miles per hour.
The objects emitted no sound, left no trail, and had estimated diameters of 30 feet.
sighted object: cigar-shaped object with a mile-long exhaust flame, and glowing meteor-like objects in the sky
witnesses: civilian observers and technical writers for North American Aviation
